# Installation, Removal and Servicing of Aids to Navigation in Prince Edward Island
## Request for Proposal (RFP) Notice
### Canadian Coast Guard (CCG)
The Canadian Coast Guard, Marine Navigation Services, requires services related to the placement, lifting, removal, maintenance, and servicing of buoys in the province of Prince Edward Island. This RFP notice seeks qualified contractors to provide these services.

### Objectives of the Requirement
The Canadian Coast Guard aims to establish aids to navigation that assist vessels in navigating safely through our waterways. This program benefits pleasure craft, fishing, and commercial vessels, ensuring the public's right to navigate.

### Scope of Work
The contractor must:

* Provide their own vessel to complete the requirement
* Inspect all buoys once a year
* Place buoys on position in accordance with navigational requirements using GPS when required
* Maintain buoys on position and in operation
* Change lanterns as required
* Lift, remove, place, store or change buoys as required
* Complete Buoy Service Reports as required

### Mandatory Technical Criteria
* The bidder must provide a copy of a Transport Canada Inspection Certificate for a vessel exceeding 15 tons gross tonnage but not exceeding 150 gross tonnage plying as a non-passenger vessel, clearly indicating "Workboat" as vessel type.
* Alternatively, a letter of confirmation of participation in the Small Vessel Compliance Program (Non-Pleasure Craft) for vessels up to 15 gross tons is required.

### Location of Work
The work will be conducted in the province of Prince Edward Island.

### Contract Period
The contract period will be from July 1, 2023, to June 30, 2025.

### Option to Extend the Contract
The contractor grants to Canada the irrevocable option to extend the term of the contract by up to two additional one-year periods under the same conditions.
